components.description:
A hazard symbol used in the labeling of biological materials that carry a significant health risk, including viral and bacteriological samples.

Generally displayed on an orange or yellow background.
components.title: Biohazard Sign

description:
A hazard symbol used in the labeling of biological materials that carry a significant health risk, including viral and bacteriological samples.

Generally displayed on an orange or yellow background.
title: Biohazard Sign

version.description:
Unicode 1.1 were pre-dated emoji inclusion in Unicode by 17 years, and included many characters primarily sourced from the Zapf Dingbats font.

The following characters were added to Unicode in 1993 and many were given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

emoji_net_data.definition: Biohazard was approved as part of Unicode 1.1 in 1993 under the name “Biohazard Sign” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Copy and paste this em http://emojipedia.org/biohazard-sign/
emoji_net_data.name: biohazard

bn:00103572a: Used of the language of the deaf

bn:00093731v: Mark with one's signature; write one's name (on)
To write (one's name) at the bottom of a document; to sign (one's name).

bn:00053450n: A perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent (as a visible clue that something has happened)
A perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent, as a visible clue that something has happened.

bn:00010536n: A biological agent -- also called bio-agent, biological threat agent, biological warfare agent, biological weapon, or bioweapon -- is a bacterium, virus, protozoan, parasite, or fungus that can be used purposefully as a weapon in bioterrorism or biological warfare.
Infectious disease or toxin that can be used in bioterrorism or biological warfare
Biological hazards, also known as biohazards, refer to biological substances that pose a threat to the health of living organisms, primarily that of humans.
Any bacterium or virus or toxin that could be used in biological warfare

bn:00025170n: An instance or cause of liable harm.
Instance or cause of liable harm.
The condition of being susceptible to harm or injury
